author: Trey Hope
content:
![1_nUheo1oNL-JDeI5CFJKWbA.jpg](/blogs/2024-04-27-coffee-code-development-with-miro/1_nUheo1oNL-JDeI5CFJKWbA.jpg)

> Cappuccino from [**Cafés De Origin**](https://cafesdeorigen.net/) in El Poblado, Medellín
> 

When it comes to building applications, I used to jump right into development.

Minimum understanding, with a lack of structured resources was always a go to for me.

However, without having a strict process to follow, I always found myself asking more questions than I should while in the middle of development.

![1_AFzsEc4-VRCDK6OU3NljVQ.gif](/blogs/2024-04-27-coffee-code-development-with-miro/1_AFzsEc4-VRCDK6OU3NljVQ.gif)

> Miro website.
> 

Maybe because of my eagerness to start coding, (I’m pretty sure that’s it), but I skipped one of the most important steps in development; creating user flows.

A user flow is a user experience (UX) concept that explores and records the actions a typical user must take to complete a specific task.

With this understanding, it makes the development smoother as you now how a solid reference on what the experience should be from the client’s perspective.

![1_bFxptW--kGEt4GnMA03hvw.gif](/blogs/2024-04-27-coffee-code-development-with-miro/1_bFxptW--kGEt4GnMA03hvw.gif)

> My example user flow for the project.
> 

There are several softwares available to create user flows, including [**ClickUp**](https://clickup.com/) and [**Figma**](https://www.figma.com/), but I decided to try out [**Miro**](https://miro.com/) because of it’s simplicity and recommendation from other developers.

I am preparing to work on a web app for a local coffee shop and felt it was the opportune time to develop this app the right way.

This is my simple user flow as of now, with navigation between pages and actions when clicking buttons.

![1_q7kz1cC_AhpBOuhJogplvw.gif](/blogs/2024-04-27-coffee-code-development-with-miro/1_q7kz1cC_AhpBOuhJogplvw.gif)

> [**Article**](https://medium.com/@flutterwtf/mobile-app-design-process-91de3fa9cf6c) from What The Flutter about a strong mobile app design process.
> 

More details coming soon as I progress on this new project.

author: Trey Hope
content:
![Preview image](/blogs/2024-04-19-coffee-code-nakama-gaming-servers/1_MexwE6ydgdh5NrPUIS5eLQ.jpg) > Columbia Peach Coffee from [**Pettibone Coffee**](https://pettibonecoffee.com/) in Dayton, OH. > Have you ever wanted to build a game in your favorite development framework? Maybe a 2D side scroller like Donkey Kong Country? Or an RPG type game similar to Pokemon? ![Nakama-docker-compose.yml, the configuration file for building the container.](/blogs/2024-04-19-coffee-code-nakama-gaming-servers/1_kdljpnkoXg6XnFji8_8NMg.jpg "Nakama-docker-compose.yml, the configuration file for building the container.")
*Nakama-docker-compose.yml, the configuration file for building the container.* Building these games on the front end might not pose much of a challenge with frameworks like Flame and Bonfire available, but what about the backend? How would you manage the data for building and scaling your game? ```bash # Command for building container. docker-compose -f nakama docker-compose.yml up ``` This is where **[Nakama](https://heroiclabs.com/nakama/)** comes in. This robust platform paves the way for game developers to build engaging online multiplayer games across a wide range of game development engines. ![The Gift-Grab container.](/blogs/2024-04-19-coffee-code-nakama-gaming-servers/1_HmwnjxfeD3UzDxquuIhdqQ.jpg "The Gift-Grab container.")
*The Gift-Grab container.* Notably, Nakama supports a diverse array of engines including, but not limited to, Godot, Unity, Unreal Engine, MonoGame, LibGDX, Defold, Cocos2d, Phaser, and Macroquad. ![Gift-Grab game running on iPad.](/blogs/2024-04-19-coffee-code-nakama-gaming-servers/1_SuN3jmx-D-whSG214uUtKA.jpg "Gift-Grab game running on iPad.")
*Gift-Grab game running on iPad.* I figured this could be useful when creating my own games in the near future. ```dart /// Create client. final client = getNakamaClient( host: '127.0.0.1', ssl: false, serverKey: 'defaultkey', ); /// Sign in via email/password. final session = await client.authenticateEmail( email: 'trey.a.hope@gmail.com', password: '123password', ) debug Print (session.userId); // flutter: 5e1f571d-e604-46cb-beb2-9076c21c4fbb ``` For now, the Gift-Grab game is going to be the test dummy for this new application, so I'll be seeing if I can setup some online capabilities for it. ![New user ready for online gaming.](/blogs/2024-04-19-coffee-code-nakama-gaming-servers/1_aVeJj1Umk8vuJNY-2ncnOg.jpg "New user ready for online gaming.")
*New user ready for online gaming.* To install Nakama, I'm using Docker to build the **container** where the project will live. What project are you currently focused on? Drop a comment and let me know please.
